# Draft:Edward Harris (footballer)

----
Edward "Ed" Harris (born 3 November 1990) was an English professional footballer renowned for his career as a defender playing over 400 games primarily in the National League and National League South.
Career
Born in Roehampton, London During a career spanning from 2016 to 2023, Harris made over 400 appearances. He began his professional journey in the academies of Southampton and Queens Park Rangers, ultimately earning a professional contract with the latter. He was named in the first-team squad for a 4-0 victory against Preston North End . Harris transitioned to non-league football, where he accumulated over 400 senior appearances and achieved four promotions. His journey saw him represent a series of clubs, including Hayes & Yeading United (on loan), AFC Wimbledon, Dover Athletic, Havant & Waterlooville, and Dorking Wanderers.
Hayes and Yeading
In February 2010. As a 19-year-old Harris was sent on loan to Hayes & Yeading United for the remainder of the season. 1  Signed by manager Garry Haylock on transfer deadline day, Harris was brought in to help the club fight relegation from the Blue Square Premier. During his loan, he made 13 league appearance.
AFC Wimbledon
Harris signed for AFC Wimbledon on a free transfer in August 2010, joining the club then competing in the Conference Premier. In the 2010-11 season, the 20-year-old defender established himself as a reliable squad member, making 23 appearances in all competitions for the 2010-11 side that saw AFC Wimbledon gain promotion to the Football League with a dramatic penalty shoot-out win over Luton.
Dover Athletic
In March 2011, near the end of the season, Harris joined Dover Athletic on loan for a month. Harris was recruited to solve a defensive "injury crisis" at the club as they pushed for a play-off position. The club officially praised his "attitude and ability," which "helped Whites to keep their play-off hopes alive at a vital moment".
He was recalled by AFC Wimbledon ahead of their own play-off campaign, though an injury sustained at Dover would have sidelined him for their next match regardless. After being released by Wimbledon at the season's end, Harris made a permanent move to Dover Athletic on a free transfer for the 2011-12 campaign. He featured for the club during that season making a total of 37 appearances for the club before departing.
Havant and Waterlooville
In the summer of 2012, Ed Harris joined Havant & Waterlooville, a move that would see him spend over seven years at Westleigh Park, amassing over 250 appearances.
The pinnacle of Harris's time with "The Hawks"  was the achievement of back-to-back promotions between 2016 and 2018.
* 2016–17 Isthmian League Premier Division Champions: After suffering an ACL injury and missing  all of the relegation season the previous year, Harris returned and became a key part of the squad that dramatically clinched the Isthmian League title on the final day of the season, securing promotion back to the National League South.
* 2017–18 National League South Champions: In the following season, Harris was again a central figure as Havant & Waterlooville achieved a second consecutive promotion by winning the National League South championship. He made 47 appearances across all competitions and missed only 1 league game during this triumphant campaign. This historic success propelled the club into the National League, the highest level of non-league football, for the first time. The success was built on a formidable defensive record, with the team conceding only 30 goals in 42 league games.     In May 2019, following the appointment of a new manager, Harris announced his departure from the club
Dorking Wanderers
Following his departure from Havant & Waterlooville, Harris joined Dorking Wanderers ahead of the 2019-20 National League South season where he made a total of 105 appearances for the club and helped the club secure promotion to the National League for the first time in Dorking's history.
